Description: Lip and wall sherd of North Ionian black-figured pottery bowl; interior streaky black with reserved band below lip and added white-red-white band on wall; exterior, cream slip, glaze fired mostly orange-red; animal frieze with hindquarters of lion to right, details incised; filling ornament of dotted rosette; band of tongues at lip, one of them red.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.218)
